required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Liposomal Bupivacaine (Exparel 速 ) Plus 0.5% Bupivacaine HCL Versus 0.5% Bupivacaine HCL for Interscalene Nerve Block (ISB) for Patients Undergoing Total Shoulder Arthroplasty(TSA)
clinical_study.official_title: Liposomal Bupivacaine (Exparel 速 ) Plus 0.5% Bupivacaine HCL Versus 0.5% Bupivacaine HCL for Interscalene Nerve Block (ISB) for Patients Undergoing Total Shoulder Arthroplasty(TSA)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase IV , randomized, single-blind, single-center study comparing patient related outcomes such as postoperative pain and opioid usage for patients who receive ISB 's containing liposomal bupivacaine (Exparel速) plus 0.5% bupivacaine HCL versus 0.5% bupivacaine HCL undergoing total shoulder arthroplasty. The objective of this study is to compare opioid utilization and pain management of patients who receive Exparel in an ISB vs standard 0.5% bupivacaine HCL during the initial 72 --- hour post --- operative period. Additionally, to understand the duration of block after addition of Exparel速 to bupivacaine in an Interscalene block after TSA.

secondary_outcome.description: Patient reported pain intensity assessment. Patients will be asked 3 questions, with a range of scores of 1-"Had no pain" to 5- "Very Severe."

arm_group.arm_group_label: Interscalene nerve block with Liposomal + Bupivacaine 0.5%
arm_group.description: Administered in an Interscalene block for TSA

intervention.arm_group_label: Interscalene nerve block with Liposomal + Bupivacaine 0.5%

intervention.description: 0.5% Bupivacaine HCL for Interscalene Nerve Block (ISB)

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in this article, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices). Data will be available to achieve aims in the approved proposal.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Immediately following publication. No end date
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Requests should be directed to uchenna.umeh@nyulangone.org. To gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement. Access will be given to researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal and investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved by an independent review committee ("learned intermediary") identified for this purpose.
